channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Judge hears case on legality of National Guard's deployment in L.A.
item.description: A federal judge is considering whether the President Trump violated laws about the use of the military in law enforcement during his deployment of the National Guard in Los Angeles.

item.title: Trump's takeover 'out of touch' with facts on the ground, says D.C. attorney general
item.description: Washington, D.C., Attorney General Brian Schwalb says Metropolitan Police Department officers must follow local policies that govern their policing, even as Trump vows to crack down on crime.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: President Trump asserts federal control over Washington, D.C.'s police force, European leaders will meet with Trump virtually before U.S.-Russia summit, Ford plans to build a cheaper electric truck.

item.title: What one of Jeffrey Epstein's victims wants from the Trump administration
item.description: What do Jeffrey Epstein's victims want from the Trump administration? NPR's Leila Fadel asks one of them.

item.title: Gaza City residents react to Israeli military plans for major new offensive
item.description: Israel says it will launch a major new ground offensive to take control of all of Gaza. Exhausted residents of Gaza City say they won't be able to evacuate.

item.title: RFK Jr. undermines trust in expertise at Department of Health and Human Services
item.description: From firing vaccine experts to cutting off research funding, Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has undermined trust in expertise at U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

item.title: European leaders to hold virtual summit with Trump ahead of his meeting with Putin
item.description: European leaders, wary Trump could strike a Ukraine deal with Putin that endangers the continent's security, will hold "an emergency virtual summit" Wednesday with Trump before the U.S.-Russia summit.

item.title: Estonian Foreign Minister Margus Tsahkna discusses planned Trump-Putin meeting
item.description: NPR's A Martinez speaks with Margus Tsahkna, foreign minister of the Baltic nation of Estonia, about President Trump's scheduled summit with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

item.title: Two people killed and 10 injured in U.S. Steel Clairton Coke Works explosion
item.description: Two people were killed and 10 injured in an explosion at the sprawling U.S. Steel Clairton Coke Works in Western Pennsylvania.

item.title: A look at the deal to allow Nvidia chip sales to China in exchange for revenue
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin speaks with Peter Harrell of the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace about the Trump administration's deal to allow AI chip sales to China in exchange for revenue.
